section.name: Apache Commons Gpg Plugin
section.p: This is a Maven 2.x Plugin which is designed to be used in release profiles for packages such as source and binary archives.

It is an extension of the standard Maven Gpg Plugin that can generate signatures for any specified files (not just ones that are attached to the project). It is hoped that the functionality will eventually be added to the Maven plugin, at which point this plugin will become redundant.
Note: the signing is done using the same code as Maven Gpg Plugin 1.4; the same properties and configuration items are supported. In addition, this plugin supports includes/excludes, see below.
As with the Maven Gpg Plugin, it is assumed that the user has installed and configured GnuPG or GnuPG2 on their system.

section.name: Plugin Goals
section.p:
Available Goals:
commons-gpg:signfiles - generate gpg signatures of specified files
commons-gpg:help - display the plugin help as per help:describe

section.name: Trying out the plugin
section.p:
Configure the plugin in the <build> section of the pom.xml
<plugin> <groupId>org.apache.commons</groupId> <artifactId>commons-gpg-plugin</artifactId> <version>1.0</version> <configuration> <includes> <include>target/releases/*.zip</include> <include>target/releases/*.tar.gz</include> </includes> <excludes> <!-- Optional --> <exclude>target/release/README*</exclude> </excludes> </configuration> <executions> <execution> <goals> <goal>signfiles</goal> </goals> <!-- must run after assembly and before deploy --> <phase>verify</phase> </execution> </executions> </plugin>
